name: Pizza Slice
funFact: Pizza was one of the top-requested food emojis.
originStory: Introduced to represent one of the most beloved foods globally.
culturalMoment: Heavily used during pizza party invites, Super Bowl tweets, and even by political campaigns!

name: Party Popper
funFact: One of the most used emojis on New Year‚Äôs Eve.
originStory: Created to visually convey celebration and joy.
culturalMoment: Widely used in birthday wishes, virtual celebrations, and Twitch chat!

name: Unicorn
funFact: The unicorn emoji is often used to represent something magical, rare, or LGBTQ.
originStory: Added to symbolize fantasy and mythical creatures.
culturalMoment: Popularized by 'unicorn food' trends and viral memes like 'I‚Äôm a unicorn.'

name: Rocket
funFact: Frequently used to represent rapid growth, ambition, or space exploration.
originStory: Designed to symbolize technology, progress, and space travel.
culturalMoment: Heavily used during SpaceX launches and crypto hype ('To the moon!').

name: Sushi
funFact: One of the most popular food emojis in Japan.
originStory: Added to represent Japanese cuisine and global food culture.
culturalMoment: Used in foodie posts, anime references, and 'sushi date' tweets.

name: Robot
funFact: Often used in discussions about AI, sci-fi, or automation.
originStory: Created to represent technology and futuristic themes.
culturalMoment: Popular in memes about robots taking over jobs and AI chatbots.

name: Sauropod
funFact: The only dinosaur emoji (T-Rex is separate).
originStory: Added to appeal to paleontology fans and kids.
culturalMoment: Used in memes like 'How it feels to walk in a group of tall friends.'

name: Doughnut
funFact: One of the most requested dessert emojis.
originStory: Added to satisfy sweet tooths worldwide.
culturalMoment: Popular in 'treat yourself' posts and Homer Simpson memes.

name: Bubble Tea
funFact: A late but highly demanded addition to the emoji keyboard.
originStory: Reflects the global rise of boba tea culture.
culturalMoment: Used by boba lovers and in Asian diaspora communities.

name: Flying Saucer
funFact: Often used in alien conspiracy jokes.
originStory: Added to represent extraterrestrial life and sci-fi.
culturalMoment: Popular in UFO memes and 'take me with you' jokes.

name: Sloth
funFact: Became a symbol for slow productivity and relaxation.
originStory: Added to represent wildlife and cute animals.
culturalMoment: Used in 'me on Monday' memes and slow internet jokes.

name: Mage
funFact: Often used in fantasy RPG and witchcraft contexts.
culturalMoment: Popular in Harry Potter memes and D&D discussions.
